result.title: Final Conceptual framework
result.description: The revised conceptual framework will document the conceptual pathway undergone along with the project and will show how the initial set of concepts have evolved on the basis of the participatory empirical work. The final model and narrative will provide the basis for key project messages to be left as one of the main results of the project, contributing to the advancement of theoretical knowledge in the field. Revised conceptual framework will be delivered on month 46, and a policy brief will synthetize its main messages.

result.description: The DECO strategy of the project will include a) the objectives; b) main MOVING messages; c) target audiences, d) key communication, dissemination and exploitation products; e) the channels for exploitation, dissemination, communication.

result.title: Conceptual and analytical framework draft
result.description: This task will allow to select and refine the relevant concepts - and relations between them on which the consortium will focus in the subsequent WPs. A literature review will ensure that the conceptual framework is up to date. This will lead to a draft report (M6), which will also provide a first list of messages for the communication activities.

result.title: Policy Audit and Policy Design Toolkit
result.description: A Policy Roadmap will be developed to illustrate how the long-term provision of a balanced mix of private and public goods can be secured within any given mountain VC. An important focus will be the identification of feasible policy mixes for enabling the repertoire of strategic options developed in WP6. MOVING Policy Roadmap will include a Quick Start Policy Design Toolkit, with guidelines for future policy formulation.

result.title: Clustering and synergies with other EU projects
result.description: MOVING clustering actions aim to go further and advance knowledge on how connections can be made across cross-consortia networks, ensure that such collaborations are more than the sum of their parts and identify enabling and blocking factors.

result.title: Global Upgrading Strategy
result.description: Using the outcomes of T4.5, particularly where participants have identified areas of vulnerability, further analysis will be carried out to consider how to upgrade the producers role in the VCs and where there are opportunities to add more value through synergies. It will build on the narratives and opportunities developed in by the regional CoP.

result.title: Youth engagement report
result.description: MOVING aims to engage young people living in mountain regions, through 1participatory workshop per region with young people (secondary school and undergraduates). Activities will be held in the second year of the project, once the study cases are selected; and will foster the participation of young people as part of their regional CoP.

result.title: List of selected value-chains and relationship building
result.description: Combining the insights from the draft conceptual framework with the inventory, the most relevant VCs in the 23 reference regions will be selected to represent the assemblage of VCs within the socio-ecological region. An initial list of the selected VCs per region will be released in M9. The final cases will be confirmed by end of M12.

result.title: Land use systems vulnerability matrixes and vulnerability maps for the 23 reference regions.
result.description: Application of a participatory perspective to the vulnerability assessment of land systems across the reference regions gathering information from selected experts and citizens with local knowledge in each reference region. With their support we will identify the vulnerability indicators of each relevant farming and forestry system in face of the known changes; and will associate vulnerability levels with productivity thresholds.A map of the vulnerability of primary production in farming and forestry systems will be done in some of the reference regions, as a result of known climate change and other specific regional changes or threats (e.g. fire, landslides). We aim to model productivity of the dominant crops and other productions related with each land use system using the data previously collected to provide forecasts in relation to the expected changes assessed.
